places.name: Cristo de la Concordia
places.description: The Cristo de la Concordia is a colossal statue, which has been part of its tourist attractions since 1987.
places.address: Av. de la Concordia, Cerro San Pedro

places.name: Parque de la Familia
places.description: With this visit to the Parque de la Familia, we will enjoy the greatest light and water fountain show. A walk full of color, music, and fun that you simply can't miss.

places.name: FEXCO
places.description: The fastest-growing international fair in the country, where business, culture, and international experiences come together. Be part!

places.name: Hupermall
places.description: Hupermall is a modern shopping center offering a wide variety of national and international brands, entertainment options.
places.address: Av. América entre Villarroel y Ricardo Jaimes Freyre

places.name: Plaza Colón
places.description: Plaza Colón is one of the most traditional and vibrant squares in Cochabamba, surrounded by shops, cafes, and historical buildings.

places.name: Plaza 14 de Septiembre
places.description: Located in the heart of the city. It is surrounded by iconic buildings such as the cathedral and government offices.

places.name: Tren Metropolitano
places.description: The Estación del Tren Metropolitano is part of modern public transport system. It connects various parts of the city and nearby municipalities.
places.address: Av. 6 de Agosto, Zona Estación Central

places.name: El Pueblito
places.description: El Pueblito, is a small historic neighborhood, in the Tupuraya area. It is considered one of the first indigenous settlements that existed in the city.
places.address: Zona Tupuraya, noroeste de la ciudad
